sentences.english: However, many young people do not seem to realize the importance of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多年轻人似乎没有实现谦逊的重要性。

sentences.english: Without humility none of this will happen.
sentences.chinese: 没有谦逊，这一切都不会发生。

sentences.english: His modesty certainly appealed to the public.
sentences.chinese: 他的谦逊无疑使民众倾心。

sentences.english: Humility is not modesty either, Tangney argues.
sentences.chinese: Tangney认为谦逊也不等同于谦虚。

sentences.english: We got loaded onto a bus after a modest delay.
sentences.chinese: 谦逊的晚点过后，我们上了一辆公共汽车。

sentences.english: While he was proud he was also a modest man.
sentences.chinese: 他感到自豪，但他也是一个谦逊的人。

sentences.english: "She was the most humble, sweet person, " Valentin said.
sentences.chinese: “她是一个非常谦逊和友善的人，”瓦伦丁说。

sentences.english: If thou hast wit & learning, add to it Wisdom and Modesty.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有了聪明和学识，就再添上智慧和谦逊吧。
谦逊是一种良好的品质。

sentences.english: Modesty is not only and ornament, but also a guard to virtue.
sentences.chinese: 谦逊不仅可增添光彩也可以维护美德。

sentences.english: The finding also underscores the link between humor and humility.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究同样强调了幽默与谦逊之间的联系。

sentences.english: Professionals are humble and generous in their praise of others.
sentences.chinese: 专业人士在赞美它人时应是谦逊和慷慨的。

sentences.english: Cersei learns that true humility and contrition don't come easy.
sentences.chinese: 瑟曦终于懂得了真正的谦逊与悔恨是来之不易的。

sentences.english: "Humility is a big part of my lesson here, " Mr.
sentences.chinese: “谦逊是我在这里学到的重要一课，”赫西说。

sentences.english: And he tries to "prevent" them with his humble ode.
sentences.chinese: 弥尔顿努力想用谦逊的颂歌来“阻止“他们。

sentences.english: Tho modesty is a virtue, bashfulness is a vice.
sentences.chinese: 谦逊虽是美德，羞怯却是缺点。

definition: neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
amiable and approachable (idiom); easy-going/modest and unassuming/(of writing) plain and simple/easy to understand
